reviewText: Classic game. Simple early platformer with a few nice-for-the-time flourishes - overworld map linking levels together,  and tricky puzzles.  Extremely dated graphics and sound nowadays, obviously, but that's part of the charm - if you want to play one of these lo-fi platformers, this is the real deal.

reviewText:
Simple puzzle platformer. 80 levels total. Takes a few hours to play through them all.
Only play this if you really have nothing better to do. Or just play the 4th chapter to see the ending.

The collision box of everything is a full square, even bullets and spikes.
Jumping has an unpredictable delay, and sometimes doesn't register at all.
Character just flips direction when turning, making it hard to stay in one spot when sliding on ice.
Most levels contain traps, prepare to re-do each level at least five times.

reviewText: Love CGA graphics and hate sound cards? Well Arctic Adventure might be the platform game you are looking for.  AA is a puzzle platformer from 1991 with all the good and bad that comes from being a classic PC Game.  One note is that so far as I can tell the gamepad config is not complete and you have to use the keyboard to fire your gun (at least with my 360 controller this happened). A general review and 4 levels of play in the video below.\n\nhttps://youtu.be/b6kxN3Qhs2A

reviewText:
A great 2D platform jumping game by Apogee!

You're an archaeologist who works for Dr. Jones (StarTropics or Indiana Jones reference [Or Both]!?)
Jumping on platforms and switches to unlock hidden blocks, hidden coins and access areas to gain extra points, pickaxes or bullets.
The bullets, which look like condoms on the lower right of the screen, are used to shoot enemies.
The pickaxes are used to break open the blocks in order to reach a key and exit the dungeon, you need all the pickaxes to exit the level.
The diamonds/circles are points for high scores.
One hit and you die, losing your points, items and bullets earned on the level you died on, restarting in the cave having to re-obtain everything again.

A very fun classic!

7/10

reviewText:
This game is from the old days and its not bad, but its a platformer. Pixelated platformer. You can move, jump and shoot from your pistol. Very limited ammuniton, but that is not a bad thing, because you can jump over enemies.
-Each level is a one screen level.
-One pipe marks the start and one pipe marks the exit. The exit pipe is blocked by a bunch of blocks that need to be destroyed and your quest is to find the exact number of pickaxes need for these blocks.
-There are also buttons that add or remove blocks from the level so if you dont know what to do, then look for a button.
-Jump height is fixed, doesnt matter whether you hold or lightly tap the jump button.
-Some blocks are breakable with your head.
-Some blocks look like walls but contain gold.
-Annoying blocks of ice(make you slide) and flying blocks are in this game too. Also spikes.

Challenging platformer from the old days.

..it's the kind of game we played as kids on the ZX Spectrum / BBC / etc. - and there's a certain charm to it - but the sound effects are cripplingly bad... I'm not sure what it can bring to the table this century to be fair... a nice example of a game played back in the 'good old days'...
